intro: Cheilanthes tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, including parts of Tibet, Nepal, and Bhutan. This perennial plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found growing on stone surfaces or in crevices. Its fronds are typically small and leathery, adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. The plant is characterized by its spore-producing structures, which are essential for its reproductive cycle in its natural habitat.
